intro: Hieracium fuscum subsp. fusciforme, commonly known as the brown hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, hairy foliage. Its flowers are yellow, with a distinctive, flattened shape, and it produces achenes as its reproductive structures. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
